author: Javier Cabrera Martínez
title: Hallan cuerpos de 3 hombres en Culiacán; presumen que su muerte podría estar relacionada con ataque a vivienda
text:
Culiacán, Sin. a 9 de Abril.- En la colonia Las Vegas, al oriente de la capital del estado fueron localizados los cuerpos de tres hombres asesinados, se presume que sus muertes, pueden estar relacionados con el ataque a balazos a una vivienda, a la cual incendiaron, sobre la calle Cristóbal Colón y Xicoténcatl, a solo cien metros de distancia.
A causa de las repetidas detonaciones de
fusiles automáticos, en dos planteles educativos, de primaria y secundaria que se ubican a tres calles de distancia de estos hechos, el personal docente activó los protocolos de seguridad y resguardaron a los estudiantes en el interior de las aulas, ante el temor de posibles balas perdidas.
Las fuerzas estatales y federales escoltaron a elementos del Cuerpo de Bomberos notificados sobre un incendio en una casa de tres pisos, ubicada sobre la calle Cristóbal Colón, casi esquina con Xicohtencatl, en la colonia Las Vegas, la cual presentó impactos de bala en la fachada, puertas y ventanas y fue incendiada.
Leer también
Ataque a minicasino clandestino deja 4 personas lesionadas en Culiacán; reportan operativo en Mocorito
En el interior del inmueble que recibió diversos impactos de bala y su portón principal fue derribado, no se encontró a ninguna persona en su interior, por lo que se desconoce, si al momento del ataque a balazos con armas automáticos el inmueble estaba vació.
Sobre la misma calle, casi esquina con indio de Guelatao, se localizaron los cuerpos de tres personas del sexo masculino muertos, los cuales se presume que descendieron de un vehículo Jetta con blindaje el cual presentó decena de impactos de bala, por lo que las autoridades presumen que sus muertes están relacionadas con el ataque.
De acuerdo a las versiones que se divulgaron en redes sociales, el personal de la Escuela Secundaria SNTE 53 que se ubica en el mismo sector de la colonia las Vegas, al escuchar los fuertes estruendos de los disparos, obligaron a los estudiantes que salían de clases a retornar a las aulas para resguardarse por desconocer que sucedía.
Lee también
Aseguran armas, explosivos, equipo táctico y tres vehículos en Cósala, Sinaloa; uno de los autos simulaba ser naval
En tanto en la escuela Primaria “Niños Héroes”, se conoce que las maestras, tranquilizaron a los estudiantes, a los cuales les recomendaron agacharse, ante el fuerte sonido de los impactos de bala que escucharon.
Los peritos de la Fiscalía General del Estado iniciaron las primeras indagaciones sobre estos dos sucesos de violencia que se presentaron en una misma calle, para determinar como sucedieron, ya que tres personas del sexo masculino resultaron muertos.

author: Mirage News
title: Govt's Own Goal Slows Wheels of Justice, Says PSA NZ | Mirage News
text: Justice Ministry proposes to cut 11% of workforce at National Office The Government's tough on crime promise will be undermined by its own spending cuts as the Ministry of Justice proposes to shed 123 roles in important areas that support the effective functioning of the justice system. "The wheels of justice may turn slow and for good reason, but they are set to turn even slower," said Duane Leo Secretary for Public Service Association Te Pūkenga Here Tikanga Mahi. "The proposed loss of roles at the Ministry of Justice again exposes how poorly thought through the Government's rushed spending cuts have become." The Ministry is proposing to reduce its workforce by 123 roles across a range of business groups. This impacts 11% of roles at the Ministry's National Office. "The Government has made law and order a top priority, promising more police, expanding prisons, bringing back the Three Strikes law and demanding longer jail sentences. "That means more people who break the law will have to be processed by the justice system. On top of that, other New Zealanders have various reasons to connect with the justice system including the whānau of those ending up in court. We should be investing more, not less in Justice. "Instead, as we have seen with many other restructures, the Government is blind to how its rushed spending cuts, could end up undermining the very policies it wants to trumpet. "The changes as proposed will slow decision-making, and bottlenecks will grow as teams consolidate and managers become responsible for more and more. "Worse, the Government risks a less effective justice system as it cuts advisors who provide information and support to those dispensing justice on the frontline and who provide the expertise to deliver the improvements to the system that are so desperately needed. "Once again, we see the fiction of no impacts on the frontline. How can this lead to the better public services the Government promises? And all to fund tax cuts. It makes no sense," said Duane Leo. [here](/govts-own-goal-slows-wheels-of-justice-says-psa-1251352/).

author: Simran Jeet
title: 5 ways to add mindfulness to your day
text:
Next Article
5 ways to add mindfulness to your day
Simran Jeet
What's the story
Mindfulness cards are an easy way to practice mindfulness in daily life.
These cards provide simple exercises and prompts that can help you stay focused on the present moment, alleviate stress, and improve overall well-being.
By including these practices in daily routines, you can develop a more mindful approach towards life.
Here are five mindfulness cards that you can use to aid your wellness journey.
Breathing exercise
Focus on breathing
This card encourages you to take a few moments each day to focus solely on your breath.
By paying attention to the rhythm of inhaling and exhaling, you can calm your mind and body.
This practice helps in reducing anxiety and improving concentration by bringing awareness back to the present moment.
Gratitude reflection
Gratitude practice
Gratitude is one potent emotion that can change your life.
This card asks you to think of three things you are grateful for, every day.
When you acknowledge the good things in your life regularly, you create a sense of contentment and happiness. This plays a huge role in maintaining good mental health.
Body scan exercise
Body scan awareness
The body scan exercise entails mentally scanning through various body parts from head to toe.
This card takes you through this process, making you aware of any tension/discomfort in the body.
Practicing it regularly helps you relax and become more self-aware by connecting mind with body sensations.
Eating awareness
Mindful eating habits
This card centers around developing mindful eating habits by promoting awareness while eating.
It recommends being mindful of flavors, textures, and smells while eating slowly without distractions such as screens or multitasking activities around food consumption timeframes.
Hence, it also promotes healthier relationships with food choices over time periods, too!
Affirmation practice
Positive affirmations
Positive affirmations are powerful statements that can strengthen self-belief and confidence over time.
This card provides you with daily affirmations specifically designed to improve self-esteem, especially useful for those struggling with negative self-image.
By consistently affirming your worth and capabilities, you can cultivate a more positive attitude, supporting your growth and emotional strength through different phases of life.

author: Harry Smith
title: Inside McLaren’s star-studded driver academy with IndyCar sensation and three champions | F1 | Sport | Express.co.uk
text:
Pato O'Ward is one of the biggest talents in the McLaren Driver Development Programme (Image: Getty) In Lando Norris and Oscar Piastri , McLaren have two of the hottest talents in F1 in their driver line-up and while their consistently impressive performances may be attracting the attention of the sport’s top teams, Zak Brown and Andrea Stella have a wealth of talent in waiting should they need to delve into their driver academy to find their successors.
Related articles
Ex-Red Bull driver pinpoints moment that Max Verstappen 'broke' Sergio Perez
Verstappen outlines plans for after F1 retirement as Red Bull star eyes new role The McLaren Driver Development Programme has a storied history of promoting some of the sport’s biggest talents into F1 with the most notable graduates being seven-time world champion Lewis Hamilton and Norris, who has delivered 13 podiums during his five-year stint with the team so far.
Kevin Magnussen also graduated into F1 with McLaren, spending two seasons with the Woking-based team before moving on to Renault in 2016, and eventually Haas, where he remains to this date. Nyck de Vries, Alex Albon and Stoffel Vandoorne were also once part of the team’s young driver programme.
Of the five drivers currently involved in the programme, the most eye-catching name is Pato O’Ward. The 24-year-old is a four-time IndyCar race winner and has recorded 20 podium finishes during his first five seasons in the series.
The Mexican driver hasn’t finished lower than seventh in the standings since the start of the 2020 campaign and has often been the fastest and most consistent of the Arrow McLaren driver crop during his time with the team.
Click here to join our WhatsApp community to be the first to receive breaking and exclusive F1 news.
Don't miss... Ferrari chief digs out FIA over 'embarrassing story' as Toto Wolff cleared [LATEST]
F1 fans have already been given an introduction to what O’Ward is capable of. He made FP1 appearances in Abu Dhabi during both the 2022 and 2023 seasons and will be McLaren’s official test and reserve driver next year, replacing two-time IndyCar champion Alex Palou in the role.
The new-look junior team contains three reigning champions too. One of those is Gabriel Bortoleto, who stormed to the Formula 3 title in 2023 thanks to two victories and a further four podiums. The 19-year-old is making the step up to Formula 2 next year with the Invicta Virtuosi team.
16-year-old Ugo Ugochukwu also became a champion in 2023, winning one-third of the nine races in the Euro 4 Championship as he pipped Tuukka Taponen and Red Bull junior Arvid Lindblad to the title. The American teenager will be following in the footsteps of Mercedes starlet Kimi Antonelli, driving in FRECA for PREMA Racing next year.
More F1...
Daniel Ricciardo had two spins during Red Bull test that turned Marko's head [LATEST]
Red Bull and Mercedes alerted to driver that left Christian Horner with ‘regret' [LATEST]
​​Max Verstappen and Sergio Perez snubbed after latest Carlos Sainz masterclass [LATEST]
Become an Express Premium member Support fearless journalism Read The Daily Express online, advert free Get super-fast page loading Start 30-day
FREE trial
Bianca Bustamente is one of the latest additions to the McLaren ranks (Image: Getty) As well as the two junior champions, McLaren have Japanese star Ryo Hirakawa on their books. The 29-year-old is an established name in the motorsport community and is a reigning WEC champion after triumphing in the Hyperclass for Toyota in 2023.
After the conclusion of the inaugural F1 Academy season, McLaren announced that they had signed Filipina racer Bianca Bustamente to their ranks. She will be the team’s representative in the series for 2024 as the 18-year-old looks to add to her two victories and four podium finishes in her rookie campaign.
Related articles Brundle explains what he'd never say about Lewis Hamilton after Russell question Norris given advice from Brundle as McLaren warned he may 'have to walk away'
